definition: line (i.e. of people waiting)/queue
length/long/forever/always/constantly
chief/head/elder/to grow/to develop/to increase/to enhance
squadron/team/group/CL:個|个[ge4]
to form a long line (i.e. of people waiting)

sentences.english: It’s not appropriate to leave queues of taxpayers and go for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 放下排长队的纳税人去吃午饭这实在是不怎么合适。

sentences.english: All day they swung up and down the main street in long teams.
sentences.chinese: 从早到晚他们都排着长队在大街上来来回回转着。

sentences.english: People live aside usually go line up to buy its well-known juice ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 住在附近的人常常排长队购买它家有名的果汁冰淇淋。

sentences.english: Didn't you see there are many places that have long lines?
sentences.chinese: 你没看见好多地方都排着长队吗？

sentences.english: Outside, thousands of people formed up in long queues, waiting their turn to enter the hall.
sentences.chinese: 外面成千上万的人排长队等候进入大会堂。

sentences.english: Hour-long queues at the tills that snaked around the store were putting many shoppers off.
sentences.chinese: 商店里蜿蜒曲折，近一小时的长队让很多购物者却步。

sentences.english: Robinovitz pushed past the queue jamming the passageway outside the infirmary .
sentences.chinese: 罗宾诺维茨挤过在医务室门外阻塞了通道的长队。

sentences.english: you probably will have problems walking along this causeway because of the queues.
sentences.chinese: 沿着堤道走可能会有困难，因为会排长队。

sentences.english: For the people of Iwate Prefecture, it was long queues at supermarkets again.
sentences.chinese: 岩手县的人再一次在超市里排起长队。

sentences.english: Lines were forming Thursday at Apple stores and Softbank outlets in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 周四，东京的苹果门店和软库分支机构外排起了长队。

sentences.english: There are long queues on petrol forecourts.
He recalls that there was a long queue outside the ticket office everyday as people lined up to buy tickets.
sentences.chinese: 每一天，买票的人们都在售票处外排起了长队。

sentences.english: There was a long line of people at the box-office window.
sentences.chinese: 在售票处窗口外排了一长队人。

sentences.english: Buses have been lined up to help with the evacuation of Mozambicans.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车排成长队帮助撤离莫桑比克人。

sentences.english: You have to go there tomorrow. Today there must be long line at the barbershop.
sentences.chinese: 你还是明天再去吧，今天理发店里肯定排长队。

sentences.english: How Americans lined up to give blood.
sentences.chinese: 美国人如何排长队献血。

definition: to line up
to form a long queue (idiom)/(of cars) to be bumper to bumper
long queue/long line (of cars, people etc)
crowded to bursting point/filled to overflowing/jam-packed
continuously; in an endless stream (idiom)
multitude/vast crowd
packed with people/overcrowded/overpopulation
front yard as busy as a marketplace (idiom)/a place with many visitors
lit. rubbing shoulders and following in each other's footsteps/a thronging crowd
lit. not one drop can trickle through (idiom); fig. impenetrable (crowd, traffic)
bustling with activity (idiom)
lit. a banquet with no empty seats/full house/capacity crowd/standing room only
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
to wait/to wait for
to come to a place on account of its reputation (idiom); attracted to visit a famous location
back of the line/last one in line
